instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.820-2915B: What is 820-2915B? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: Hi yet another <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> b
threads.message:
I received a no power board today ive gotten it to power up. now I have quarter fan spin. There was corrosion directly on <RESISTOR>R7015</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R7012</RESISTOR> like a drop. The other area was around <CHIP>U5430</CHIP> just like droplets on each very localized. The PP3v3 goes from .6v to 2v then back to .6v again
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 12.56v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S3</SIGNAL> 3.3v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> 5v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> .6v while fan is off and 2v when on
L8120 was also a issue it was split with a burn mark :( 
will it boot without it also I don?t find this on my other spare doner boards (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>)

threads.title: Hi yet another <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> b
threads.message:
Ok I found the issue :( someone removed the gpu heatsink and reflowed the gpu and found solder balls fused together:(
so it?s a parts board.

One question though I have 2 boards that I repaired that will power on with magesafe in one direction but if I reverse  the connector to the other side it won?t power on. Not even a green light. I tried several dc in boards but have the same issue. I?m lost with these 2 they are both <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>

threads.title: Hi yet another <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> b
threads.message:
2915 board can still be used without GPU.
Just disable it in BIOS and use iGPU.
Changing GPU is not a good idea, as you will not find a real new chip anymore.

Please open new thread for the other problem...
